) Criminal Tax attorneys will be available, upon request, at any stage of an in- vestigation for discussions with Criminal Investigation personnel for the purpose of rendering legal advice. ) To request a warrant, the law enforcement officer or government attorney typically presents the magistrate with a sworn affidavit that establishes probable cause for the proposed search and seizure (or for installation and of a tracking device). If the magistrate issues the warrant, the officer has ten days to execute the warrant. The search should be performed during the daytime (between
a.m. and

p.m.) unless the issuing authority has authorized execution at other times. The officer executing the warrant is required to provide a copy of the warrant and a receipt for any property to the person from whom, or from whose premises, the property was taken. The officer must also promptly return the warrant, together with a written inventory of the property seized, to the magistrate judge. (

) Time is of the essence in all search warrant matters; therefore, Counsel complete its review and advice as expeditiously as possible. Speciﬁc time quirements for completion, review, and rendering of advice should be determined on a case-by-case basis. All such advice must be memorialized in a written to Criminal Investigation as soon as possible. A detailed explanation of the gencies warranting the rendition of oral advice must be set forth in the memorandum. (

The signiﬁcance of a criminal tax case may be determined by ing such factors as: • The amount of tax due; • The nature of the fraud; • The need for the evidence to be seized; or • The impact of the potential criminal tax case on voluntary compliance with the revenue laws. Consensual monitoring occurs when at least one party to a sation agrees to have the conversation monitored using a device, such as a body bug, telephone bug (suction cup), room bug, or video bug. Because a party to the conversation consents to the recording of it, this activity does implicate Title I. Consensual monitoring can take two forms: telephonic and non-telephonic.
